body: Added a couple simple tests for the executors returning uuid.  Not sure how to test that the uuid gets set in the model.

Found it!

The issue was there weren't enough threads, so if it takes too long to the point where other dags need to be processed it just never sleeps. This setting fixed the logging issue

```    
[scheduler]
    dag_dir_list_interval = 60
    child_process_log_directory = /root/airflow/logs/scheduler
    # Task instances listen for external kill signal (when you clear tasks
    # from the CLI or the UI), this defines the frequency at which they should
    # listen (in seconds).
    job_heartbeat_sec = 2
    max_threads = 16
```


Now just need to make the tests pass again and we're good to go :)
(also, max_threads should probably have a different name to signify its usage for DAG processing and this might potentially be a bug)
Shoot nvm When I switched back to INFO mode the issue is still there. But at least we know that's the general area where the problem exists.

@svenvarkel Please follow https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/AIRFLOW/Contributors%27+Guide in the future.. and essentially the instructions in the PR template. We need tracking JIRAs for trivial commits as well. I've created the JIRA and merged this commit (modifying the commit) message for this instance. Welcome aboard!
This fixes https://github.com/apache/incubator-airflow/pull/3225 which was closed for inactivity
https://github.com/apache/incubator-airflow/pull/3242 handles this.. I'll close this for inactivity!
In the future follow https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/AIRFLOW/Contributors%27+Guide

Thanks for the review @artwr! Addressed your comment.

@jzucker2 Are you open to adding a `SendTrackEventOperator` that takes a name and a dict to pass through to `analytics.track(...)`?

I'd be curious to know if you find other event types useful here as well, maybe `SendIdentifyEventOperator` would be nice?

@Fokko thanks for the response. Yes I am totally aware of the commit guidelines. Put this together to for the GitHub diff UI while I work on tests. Will draft up a cleaner PR when I get the tests written.

Also working on adding DMS support to moto so this can be properly unit tested before merge

https://github.com/spulec/moto/pull/1590
@Fokko I messed up my git repo while was working on an unrelated jira.. will close this PR and open a new one

I'm delighted to tell you all that this has been merged to master. By merging this to master, it is a bit easier for me to patch stuff onto this and I didn't want to put more into this PR since it is far to big already. I've squashed some of the smaller commits together. The kubernetes tests are still failing, but we should fix this before we release RC of Airflow 1.10. I'm looking at you @dimberman ;-)

Good catch. Can you please add a test and make sure you follow the remainder of the commit guidelines as well?

@bolkedebruin thanks for prompt response. I haven't done any unit tests for airflow.. can you point me to a unittest that's close to this PR, so I'll try to mimic some logic.

Regarding "remainder of the commit guidelines" - I thought I've followed everything except documentation. I don't think this hotfix needs documentation change. Did I miss something else?

@mistercrunch, I've looked at `sqlparse` library and it's very easy to create a list of sql statements like 

```
sql_statements_list = map(lambda s: str(s), sqlparse.parse(jinja_generated_sql_statements))
```

so we could avoid custom regex logix to have a more robust parse logic than just `sql.split(';')` as you mentioned above.

Only question I have - `sqlparse` library comes under BSD license, I assume it's compatible with Apache2? As both are permissive. Will put together a new PR if that looks okay to add `sqlparse` as a new dependency for Airflow. 

Thanks!
Tager, I like your thinking. Getting rid of regex is a good think. The only thing I'm a bit afraid of is how compliant this library is with all the different dialects. Cheers

@Fokko looking at list of closed PRs https://github.com/andialbrecht/sqlparse/pulls?q=is%3Apr+is%3Aclosed I see MySQL, PostgreSQL and Oracle. In the code https://github.com/andialbrecht/sqlparse/blob/master/sqlparse/keywords.py I see Microsoft SQL Server specific things. I am sure it covers a lot of of different sql dialects. I have tested `slqpare` works for Oracle. Since this PR only covers Oracle operator for now, other operators can be added later very similarly through  follow-up PRs, confirming `sqlparse` works for other operators too. But again from what I've seen `sqlparse` is generic enough to cover at least MySQL, PostgreSQL, Oracle, SQL Server.
@aoen PTAL
Awesome work, thanks @jzucker2 for the update

Looking at it again, I don't think the fix is proper. I think the fix should be here (https://github.com/Tagar/incubator-airflow/blob/997d447e71086cec7bb9ea83f9039936b850067d/airflow/models.py#L3079) by checking for None. 

A unit test should just test a DAG instantiation with a start_date `None` and can be added to `tests/models.py` there are many of them.
The impyla library used by hive hook requires thrift <= 0.9.3. So the hive connectors are not usable. Is there any way we can separate the two versions for different airflow plugins?
see https://github.com/apache/incubator-airflow/pull/3256
cc @Fokko

I wonder what we need to do with the `microseconds` here. The Rest API cuts off microseconds and we do this for backwards compatibility reasons. With this change we also cut it off from ones that are triggered from DAGs. 

While I am in favor of moving it to the common framework it needs to be checked if this works correctly for the cases that we currently support. Most likely I think the cut off needs to be moved from the common layer and move the cutoff to the frontend.

cc @Fokko
@OElesin If you want this in to 1.10 please squash your commits

This is very interesting but I am wondering how would you support a typical approach for an Airflow installation which is having the DAG's directory as a clone of a git repository with all the DAGs. And retrieving any changes at some interval.

For example, this is the idea for most helm charts of an Airflow installation on K8s with an volume that does the syncing automatically (git-sync). Possibly this is in the recent k8s executor that has been merged (I haven't fully checked it out).

The UI should also offer then committing the change (if there is a git repo or similar) behind. Otherwise, this feature is only useful for less automatic deployments of Airflow.

Also I would consider the security part as it could open for attacks. Have you had a look at the RBAC implementation. It seems to be the way that the UI is heading and I think it fits nicely with your idea.
LGTM +1
This is probably testable, just by instantiating a bare SubDagOperator and testing which executor is selected.
